articles.title: Pope makes surprise visit to Rome record store, gets classical CD
articles.description: Pope Francis is known to like Beethoven, Mozart and Bach -- and even tango music from his native Argentina.
articles.content:
Pope Francis, a lover of classical music, slipped out of the Vatican on Tuesday evening to visit old friends who run a Rome record shop and came away with a gift of a CD.
The visit was to have remained private but Javier Martinez-Brocal, a reporter f... [1500 chars]

articles.title: Wheat falls further as data creates supply pressure
articles.description: Soy, corn ease as Argentina rain outlook tempers crop fears.
articles.content:
PARIS/SINGAPORE, Jan 13 (Reuters) - Chicago and Paris wheat futures lost more ground on Thursday, pressured by increased estimates of U.S. acreage and inventories as well as reduced expectations for top EU exporter France.
Soybeans and corn edged low... [2682 chars]

articles.title: Historic heat wave hits Buenos Aires, Argentina
articles.description: AccuWeather meteorologists say portions of the southern half of the continent will experience temperatures that could rival all-time record highs, which is expected to lead to a massive strain on local infrastructure.
articles.content: Jan. 12 (UPI) -- While extreme cold has gripped parts of the United States in recent days, the very opposite has been true below the equator. In the Southern Hemisphere, summer is in full swing and a heat wave could shatter century-old temperature re... [3732 chars]

articles.title: Argentina drought, river woes push soy crushers into losses - chamber

articles.title: Argentina's dry weather could extend into March, crops risk significant losses

articles.title: Ground Temperatures Hit 129 Degrees as Argentina Suffers Blackouts
articles.description: The country is suffering through a heat wave that knocked out power in Buenos Aires and challenged all-time records.
